intro: Myosotis welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
